00002  * jcom.route
00003  * External for Jamoma: route messages to an outlet if they meet our criteria
00004  * By Tim Place, Copyright © 2005

00010 #include "Jamoma.h"
00011 
00012 #define MAX_LIST_LENGTH 100
00013 
00014 typedef struct _route{                          // Data Structure for this object
00015         t_object                ob;                                                             // REQUIRED: Our object
00016         void                    *obex;                                                  // REQUIRED: Object Extensions used by Jitter/Attribute stuff 
00017         void                    *my_outlet[2];                                  // my outlet array -- NOTE: the attribute dump outlet is handled automagically 
00018 
00019         t_symbol                *searchlist[MAX_LIST_LENGTH];   // ATTRIBUTE: storage of which inlets tigger output from the object (essentially an array of toggles)
00020         long                    searchlistlen;
00021         long                    searchpositions[MAX_LIST_LENGTH];
00022         long                    searchpositionslen;     
00023 //      long                    stripmatch;                                             // ATTRIBUTE: toggle strip_match
00024         long                    partialmatch;
00025         t_symbol                *searchsymbol;
00026 } t_route;
00027 
00028 // Prototypes for our methods:
00029 void *route_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00030 void route_assist(t_route *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst);
00031 void route_symbol(t_route *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00032 void route_list(t_route *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00033 void route_bang(t_route *x);
00034 char find_match(t_route *x, t_symbol *input, short position);
00035 
00036 // Globals
00037 t_class         *route_class;                           // Required: Global pointer for our class
00038 
00039 /************************************************************************************/
00040 // Main() Function
00041 
00042 int main(void)                          // main recieves a copy of the Max function macros table
00043 {
00044         long attrflags = 0;
00045         t_class *c;
00046         t_object *attr;
00047         
00048         jamoma_init();
00049 
00050         // Define our class
00051         c = class_new("jcom.route",(method)route_new, (method)0L, (short)sizeof(t_route), (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00052         class_obexoffset_set(c, calcoffset(t_route, obex));
00053 
00054         // Make methods accessible for our class: 
00055         class_addmethod(c, (method)route_bang,                          "bang", 0L);
00056         class_addmethod(c, (method)route_list,                          "list", A_GIMME, 0L);   
00057         class_addmethod(c, (method)route_symbol,                        "anything", A_GIMME, 0L);       
00058         class_addmethod(c, (method)route_assist,                        "assist", A_CANT, 0L); 
00059     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_dumpout,     "dumpout", A_CANT,0);  
00060     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_quickref,    "quickref", A_CANT, 0);
00061 
00062         // ATTRIBUTE: searchstring
00063         attr = attr_offset_array_new("searchstring", _sym_symbol, MAX_LIST_LENGTH, attrflags, 
00064                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_route, searchlistlen), calcoffset(t_route, searchlist));
00065         class_addattr(c, attr); 
00066 
00067         // ATTRIBUTE: searchpositions
00068         attr = attr_offset_array_new("searchpositions", _sym_long, MAX_LIST_LENGTH, attrflags, 
00069                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_route, searchpositionslen), calcoffset(t_route, searchpositions));
00070         class_addattr(c, attr); 
00071 
00072         // ATTRIBUTE: partialmatch
00073         attr = attr_offset_new("partialmatch", _sym_long, attrflags,
00074                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_route, partialmatch));
00075         class_addattr(c, attr); 
00076 
00077         // ATTRIBUTE: stripmatch
00078 //      attr = attr_offset_new("stripmatch", _sym_long, attrflags,
00079 //              (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_route, stripmatch));
00080 //      class_addattr(c, attr); 
00081 
00082 
00083         // Finalize our class
00084         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00085         route_class = c;
00086         return 0;
00087 }

00090 /************************************************************************************/
00091 // Object Life
00092 
00093 void *route_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00094 {
00095         t_route *x = (t_route *)object_alloc(route_class);
00096         if(x){
00097                 object_obex_store((void *)x, _sym_dumpout, (object *)outlet_new(x,NULL));       // dumpout
00098                         
00099                 // Create Outlets
00100                 x->my_outlet[1] = outlet_new(x, 0);
00101                 x->my_outlet[0] = outlet_new(x, 0);
00102                         
00103                 // Set defaults before I go loading in values from the attributes
00104                 x->searchlist[0] = gensym("default");
00105                 x->searchlistlen = 1;
00106                 x->searchpositions[0] = 1;
00107                 x->searchpositionslen = 1;      
00108         //      x->stripmatch = 0;
00109                 x->partialmatch = 0;
00110                 
00111                 attr_args_process(x,argc,argv); //handle attribute args 
00112         }
00113         return (x);                                                                                     // return the pointer to our new instantiation
00114 }
00115 
00116 
00117 /************************************************************************************/
00118 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00119 
00120 // Method for Assistance Messages
00121 void route_assist(t_route *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00122 {
00123         if(msg==1)                                              // Inlet
00124                 strcpy(dst, "Input");
00125         else if(msg==2){                                // Outlets
00126                 switch(arg){
00127                         case 0: strcpy(dst, "Output"); break;
00128                         case 1: strcpy(dst, "Attribute Stuff"); break;
00129                 }
00130         }               
00131 }
00132 
00133 
00134 // generate a single symbol out of the multiple symbols given in the attribute
00135 void route_bang(t_route *x)
00136 {
00137         short           i;
00138         char            newstring[500];
00139         
00140         newstring[0] = 0;
00141         for(i=0; i< (x->searchlistlen); i++){
00142                 strcat(newstring, x->searchlist[i]->s_name);
00143                 strcat(newstring, " ");
00144         }
00145         // knock out the last space
00146         newstring[strlen(newstring) - 1] = 0;
00147         
00148         x->searchsymbol = gensym(newstring);
00149 }
00150 
00151 
00152 // utility function to help out the methods
00153 char find_match(t_route *x, t_symbol *input, short position)
00154 {
00155         short i;
00156         char matched = 0;
00157         short len;
00158         
00159         for(i=0; i<MAX_LIST_LENGTH ;i++){
00160                 matched += (x->searchpositions[i] == position);
00161         }
00162         
00163         if(matched > 0){
00164                 if(x->partialmatch){
00165                         len = strlen(x->searchsymbol->s_name);
00166                         for(i=0; i<len; i++){
00167                                 if(input->s_name[i] != x->searchsymbol->s_name[i])
00168                                         return 0;
00169                         }
00170                         return 1;
00171                 }
00172                 else
00173                         return (input == x->searchsymbol);
00174         }
00175         else
00176                 return 0;
00177 }

00180 // SYMBOL INPUT
00181 void route_symbol(t_route *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00182 {
00183         short           i;
00184         char            matched;
00185         char            tempstring[50];
00186         t_symbol        *tempsym;
00187         
00188         route_bang(x);
00189         matched = 0;
00190         
00191         // match the symbol
00192         matched += find_match(x, msg, 1);
00193         
00194         // match the arguments
00195         for(i=0; i<argc; i++){
00196                 switch(argv[i].a_type){
00197                         case A_LONG:
00198                                 sprintf(tempstring, "%ld", argv[i].a_w.w_long);
00199                                 tempsym = gensym(tempstring);
00200                                 break;
00201                         case A_FLOAT:
00202                                 sprintf(tempstring, "%f", argv[i].a_w.w_float);
00203                                 tempsym = gensym(tempstring);
00204                                 break;
00205                         case A_SYM:
00206                                 tempsym = argv[i].a_w.w_sym;
00207                                 break;
00208                 }
00209                 matched += find_match(x, tempsym, i+2); 
00210         }
00211 
00212         // Output
00213         if(matched > 0)
00214                 outlet_anything(x->my_outlet[0], msg, argc , argv);
00215         else
00216                 outlet_anything(x->my_outlet[1], msg, argc, argv);              
00217 }
00218 
00219 
00220 
00221 // LIST INPUT
00222 void route_list(t_route *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00223 {
00224         short           i;
00225         char            matched;
00226         char            tempstring[50];
00227         t_symbol        *tempsym;
00228         
00229         route_bang(x);
00230         matched = 0;
00231         
00232         // match the arguments
00233         for(i=0; i<argc; i++){
00234                 switch(argv[i].a_type){
00235                         case A_LONG:
00236                                 sprintf(tempstring, "%ld", argv[i].a_w.w_long);
00237                                 tempsym = gensym(tempstring);
00238                                 break;
00239                         case A_FLOAT:
00240                                 sprintf(tempstring, "%f", argv[i].a_w.w_float);
00241                                 tempsym = gensym(tempstring);
00242                                 break;
00243                         case A_SYM:
00244                                 tempsym = argv[i].a_w.w_sym;
00245                                 break;
00246                 }
00247                 matched += find_match(x, tempsym, i+1); // NOTE THE DIFFERENCE HERE COMPARED TO ABOVE   
00248         }
00249 
00250         // Output
00251         if(matched > 0)
00252                 outlet_anything(x->my_outlet[0], msg, argc , argv);
00253         else
00254                 outlet_anything(x->my_outlet[1], msg, argc, argv);              
00255 
00256 }
